meanings.definition: To kill or wound (a fellow soldier) intentionally with a grenade or other explosive device.
meanings.sent1: During the battle, the soldier fragged the enemy with a grenade.
meanings.sent2: The soldier fragged the enemy in the war game.
meanings.sent3: The soldier accidentally fragged their own team member during training.
meanings.sent4: The explosion fragged the enemy's defenses, allowing our troops to advance.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the grenade fragging the enemy echoed through the battlefield.

meanings.definition: To defeat or eliminate (a player) in a video game by using a grenade or other explosive device.
meanings.sent1: In the game, I fragged my opponent with a well-timed grenade.
meanings.sent2: He fragged the final boss in the video game.
meanings.sent3: My character fragged the enemy player, causing them to respawn.
meanings.sent4: The explosive power-up allowed me to frag multiple opponents at once.
meanings.sent5: The grenade fragged the enemy player, securing our victory in the match.
